meanings.definition: To walk or march in a public procession or display.
meanings.sent1: The children were parading around the park with their colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: During the parade, the soldiers were parading in uniform down the street.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were parading in a line behind the mother duck, looking quite organized.
meanings.sent4: The sun was parading across the sky, casting its warm light on the earth below.
meanings.sent5: The flowers were parading their vibrant colors for all to see in the garden.

meanings.definition: To show off or display something proudly or boastfully.
meanings.sent1: She was parading her new dress to her friends, twirling around to show it off.
meanings.sent2: The peacock was parading its beautiful feathers to attract a mate.
meanings.sent3: The cat was parading its catch of the day, a small mouse, in front of the other cats.
meanings.sent4: The chef was parading his culinary skills by creating a stunning dish for the guests.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was parading his medals, proudly displaying his achievements to the crowd.
